Replies.Reply: 3 billion human lives ended on August 29th, 1997.
I can't let you take the man's wheels, son.
Your foster parents are kinda dicks, right?
Where'd you learn all this stuff?
Some cop is scoping for you, dude.
Actually, no, she's a complete psycho.  That's why she's up at Pescedero.  She tries to blow up a computer factory, but she got shot and arrested.
Yeah, she's a total loser.  C'mon, let's check out the 7-Eleven, whatya say?
Now don't take this the wrong way, but you are a terminator, right?
So this other guy?  He's a terminator too, right, like you?
Can I stop by my house?
Look, Todd and Janelle are dicks but I gotta warn them.  Shit!  You got a quarter?
Something's wrong.  She's never this nice.
The dog's really barking.  Maybe it's already there.  What should I do?
I need a minute here, okay?  You're telling me it can imitate anything it touches?
Well, why doesn't become a bomb or something to get me?
Oh, great.  And what happens to her?
TERMINATED!?  Shit!  Why didn't you tell me?
Yeah, well fuck you, she's a priority to me!
Help!  HELP!!  I'm being kidnapped!  Get this psycho off of me!
You have to do what I say?!
Cool!  My own terminator.  This is great!
Now who's the dipshit, you jock douchebag?
Listen to me, very carefully, okay?  You're not a terminator any more.  Alright?  You got that?
You just can't, okay?  Trust me on this.
Look, I'm gonna go get my mom.  You wanna come along, that's fine with me.
Now remember, you're not gonna kill anyone, right?
Just say "I swear I won't kill anyone."
It's all right, Mom.  He's here to help.
How long do you live?  I mean, last?
Can you see the pin switch?
Look, Mom, if I'm supposed to ever be this great leader, you should start listening to my leadership ideas once in a while.  'Cause if you won't, nobody else will.
Yeah, or "later, dickwad."  Or if someone gets upset you say "chill out."  Like that.  Or you can do combinations.
That's great!  See, you're getting it.
Only a couple hundred bucks.  I'll give you half.
And that's another thing.  You could lighten up a bit, yourself.  This severe routine is getting old.  Smile once in a while.
Yeah.  Smile.  You know.  People smile, right?
Hi.  Nice place you got here.  How's business?
Okay.  Bad example.  Over there, look.
I don't know, maybe you could practice in front of a mirror or something.
We're not gonna make it, are we?  People, I mean.
Yeah, I thought you'd like this place.
Then, when Mom got busted I got put in a regular school.  The other kids were, like, into Nintendo.
You don't feel any emotion about it one way or the other?
Yeah.  I have to stay functional too.
There was this one guy that was kinda cool.
Here.  I wish I coulda met my real dad.

Yeah.  I guess so.  My mom says when I'm, like, 45, I think, I send him back through time to 1984.  But right now he hasn't even been born yet.  Man, is messes with your head.  Where's that other bolt?
Thanks.  Mom and him were only together for one night, but she still loves him, I guess.  I see her crying sometimes.  She denies it totally, of course.  Like she says she got something in her eye.
You mean people?  I don't know.  We just cry.

Replies.Didascalie: (snaps his fingers as it hit him)

Replies.Reply: Yeah, gotta be!  Miles Dyson!  She's gonna blow him away!
Come on.  Let's go.  LET'S GO!!
I don't care.  We've gotta stop her.
I don't care!! There's gotta be another way.
Look, maybe you don't care if you live or die.
It's okay.  It'll by okay.  We'll figure it out.
Mom, Mom, we need to be more constructive here.
I got it.  Piece of cake.
And let's see what's behind door number one.
Got ol' Skynet by the ball now, Miles.  Come on, let's book!
Okay, Mom, we gotta get out now, come on.
Come on, Mom, you can do it!  Come on!!
No, no no!!  It'll be okay.  Stay with us!
I swear I've had it with that goddamn kid.
There was a guy here this morning asking about him, too.
John?  Where are you, honey?  It's late.  You should come home, dear.  I'm making a casserole.
Wolfy's fine, honey.  Where are you?
John!  Get your ass inside right now and do what your mother says!
That's right, officer.  What's he done now?
Well, you could if he was here.  Be he took off on his bike this morning.  Could be anywhere.
Yeah, big guy.  On a bike.  Has that got something to do with it?
What the hell's the goddamn dog barking at?
The next patient is a 29-year old female diagnosed as acute schizo-affective disorder.
Douglas, I don't like seeing the patients disturbing their rooms like this.  See that she takes her thorazine, would you?
Yes.  Your attitude have been very positive lately.
I see.  Let's go back to what you were saying about these terminator machines.  Now you think they don't exist?
But you've told me on many occasions about how you crushed one in a hydraulic press.
I see.  So you don't believe anymore that the company covered it up?
I'm afraid not.  Not for a while.  I don't see any choice but to recommend to the review board that you stay here another six months.
Lewis, see these gentleman out and them lock up for the night.
It won't work, Sarah.  You're no killer.  I don't believe you'd do it.
Good morning, Dr. Silberman.  How's the knee?
I know, but I'm not as strong as I'm supposed to be.  I can't do it.  I'm screwing up the mission.
It has helped me a lot to have a goal, something to look forward to.
You said I could be transferred to the minimum security wing and have visitors if I showed improvement in six months.  Well, it's been six months, and I was looking forward to seeing my son.
They don't exist.  I see that now.
If I had, there would have been some evidence.
So what do you think, Doctor?  I've shown a lot of improvement, haven't I?
You have to let me see my son.  Please.  It's very important.  He's in danger.  At least let me call him --
Goddammit.  Let me go!!  Silberman!  You don't know what you're doing!  You fuck!  You're dead!
There's 215 bones in the human body, motherfucker.
Open it or he'll be dead before he hits the floor.
You're already dead, Silberman.  Everybody here dies.  You know I believe that.  So don't fuck with me!
No!  Help me!  Goddamnit, it's gonna kill us all!!!
It was stupid of you to go there.
Goddamnit, John, you have to be smarter than that.  You're too important!  You can't risk yourself, not even for me, do you understand?
Stop it!  Right now!  You can't cry, John.
Pull in here.  We have to ditch this car.
I'll bet. Makes you a more efficient killer, right?
That's good.  Because if you can't pass for human, you won't be much good to us.
Doesn't want you thinking too much, huh?
I don't trust it!  These things are hard to kill, John, believe me, I know.  We may never have this opportunity again.
Keep it under sixty-five.  We can't afford to be pulled over.
I need to know how Skynet get built.  Who's responsible?
Uh huh, great.  Then those fat fucks in Washington figure, what the hell, let a computer run the whole show, right?
How much do you know about Dyson?
I want to know everything.  What he looks like.
I just came for my stuff.  And I need clothes, food, and one of your trucks.
You two are on weapons detail.
Yeah.  I'm gonna wait till dark to cross the border.
Enrique, it's dangerous for you here.  You get out tonight, too, okay?
Don't fucking move!  Don't FUCKING MOVE!!
Get on the floor, bitch!  Now!!  Fucking down!
Shut up, kid!  Get out of the way!!
Shut up!  SHUT UP!!  Motherfucker!  It's all your fault!  IT'S YOUR FAULT!!
I love you, John.  I always have.
Yeah.  Right.  How were you supposed to know?
Son of a bitch, I knew it!
Can you get us in there, past security?
Is it safe for them here?
NO!! We're going all the way!  You got that, Dyson?
Dyson, hand me the detonator.  Let's go --
John?  John?  Can you hear me?  Where are you?
John, get out of the way!!
August 29th 1997 came and went.  Nothing much happened.  Michael Jackson turned forty.  There was no Judgment Day.  People went to work as they always do, laughed, complained, watched TV, made love.

That was thirty years ago.  But the dark future which never came still exists for me, and it always will, like the traces of a dream lingering in the morning light.  And the war against the machines goes on.  Or, to be more precise, the war against those who build the wrong machines.
Time to take you meds, Connor.
Open the door!  The goddamn bitch is loose in the halls!
Are you the legal guardian of John Connor?
Could I speak with him, please?
I just need to ask him a few questions.
I wouldn't worry.  Do you have a photograph of John?
I know.  This is a dream, Sarah.
I love you.  I always will.
It's John who's the target now.  You have to protect him.  He's wide open.
Don't quit, Sarah.  Our son need you.
There's not much time left in the world, Sarah.
It's not just a dream.  It's real, you moron!
On August 29th 1997 it's going to feel pretty fucking real to you, too!  Anybody not wearing number two million sunblock in gonna have a real bad day, get it?
You're the one living in a dream, Silberman, not me!  Because I know it happens.  It happens!
I'm sure it feels very real to you --
Yup.  Come on.  I'll get it.
I asked them that question once.  Know what they told me?  Don't ask.
Oh.  I can't, honey.  I'm on a roll here.
Baby, this thing is going to blow 'em all away.
I'm sorry, honey, it's just that I'm thiiis close.
Imagine a jetline with a pilot that never makes a mistake, never gets tired, never shows up to work with a hangover.
In the bathroom.  Danny, can you get them for us?
I feel like I'M gonna throw up.
You're judging me on thing's I haven't even done yet.  Jesus.  How were we supposed to know?
Look, whatever you want me to do, I'll do.  I just want my kids to have a chance to grow up, okay?
Do you know about the chip?
It's gotta be from the other one like you.
Evening, Paul.  These are friends of mine from out of town, I just thought I'd take them up and show them around.
Silent alarm's been tripped.  It neutralizes the codes throughout the building.  Nothing'll open now.
We'll have to keep these on a couple minutes, till the gas clears.
Give me that thing a second.
I've worked for years on this thing.
How do you set them off?
Yeah, he was here about fifteen minutes ago.  I think he said he was going to the Galleria.
I'm a cybernetic organism.  Living tissue over a metal endoskeleton.
My mission is to protect you.
You did.  Thirty years from now you reprogrammed me to be your protector here, in this time.
Not like me.  A T-1000.  Advanced prototype.
You are targeted for termination.  The T-1000 will not stop until it complete its mission.
We have to leave the city, immediately.  And avoid the authorities.
Negative.  The T-1000 will definitely try to reacquire you there.
Hey, Janelle, what's wrong with Wolfy?  I can hear him barking.  Is he okay?
Your foster parents are dead.  Let's go.
Anything it samples by physical contact.
No.  Only an object of equal size.
It can't form complex machines.  Guns and explosives have chemicals, moving parts.  It doesn't work that way.  But it can form solid metal shapes.
Negative.  The T-1000's highest probability for success now would be to copy Sarah Connor and wait for you to make contact with her.
Typically, the subject being copied is terminated.
Negative.  She is not a mission priority.
That is one of my mission parameters.
I swear I will not kill anyone.
Come with me if you want to live.
What is wrong with your eyes?
Ballistic penetration shocks it, but only for a few seconds.
I have detailed files on human anatomy.
I sense injuries.  The data could be called pain.
A hundred and twenty years on my existing power cell.
Hold the CPU by its base tab.  Pull.
It is in your nature to destroy yourselves.
The man most directly responsible is Miles Bennet Dyson, Director of Special Projects at Cyberdyne Systems Corporation.
In a few months he creates a revolutionary type of mircoprocessor.

In three years Cyberdyne will become the largest supplier of military computer systems.  All stealth bombers are upgraded with Cyberdyne computers, becoming fully unmanned,  Afterward, the fly with a perfect operational record.

The Skynet funding bill is passed.  The system goes on-line August 4th, 1997.  Human decisions are removed from strategic defense.  Skynet begins to learn, at a geometric rate.  It becomes self-aware at 2:14 a.m. eastern time, August 29.
Yes.  It launches its ICBMs against their targets in Russia.
Because Skynet knows the Russian counter-strike will remove its enemies here.
No.  I have to stay functional until my mission is complete.  Then it doesn't matter.
She intends to change the future somehow.
The T-1000 has the same files that I do.  It could anticipate this move and reacquire you at Dyson's house.
Killing Dyson might actually prevent the war.
Now listen to me very carefully.
No one must follow your work.
The CPU from the first terminator.
Take your kids.  Go to a hotel.  Right now.
Cover you ears and open you mouth.
Keep your eyes closed.  Don't move.
And it must be destroyed also.
I have to go away, John.
I know now why you cry.  But it is something I can never do.
Yeah?  Fuck you, you little dipshit.
These were taken at the West Highland police station in 1984.  You were there.
He killed seventeen police officers that night.
This one was taken by a Japanese tourist today.
Ms. Connor, you've been told that your son's missing.  His foster parents have been murdered, and we know this guy's involved.  Talk to us.
Gotta check the gun first, Lewis.
You going to work all day?
You need a break.  You'll see it clear when you come back.
Miles, it's Sunday.  You promised to take the kids to Raging Waters today.
I know.  You told me.  It's a neural-net processor.  It thinks and learns like we do.
Why did you marry me, Miles?  Why did we have these two children?  You don't need us.  Your heart and your mind are in here.
But it doesn't love you like we do.

So, Sarahlita, you getting famous, you know that?  All over the goddamn TV.
Hey, how about the fillings out of my fucking teeth while you're at it?

Just drop by any time and totally fuck up my life.
